Title: A Toolkit for Centering Racial Equity Throughout Data Integration
Description: Centering racial equity is not a single, discrete step. A Toolkit for Centering Racial Equity Throughout Data Integration describes positive and problematic practices for centering racial equity across the six stages of the data life cycle
Organization: Actionable Intelligence for Social Policy, UPenn

Title: Introduction to Data Sharing
Description: This Introduction to Data Sharing & Integration was created by Actionable Intelligence for Social Policy (AISP) as a primer on the basics of using, sharing, and integrating administrative data. Administrative data are data collected during the routine process of administering programs, but can also be repurposed to support evaluation, analysis, and research.
Organization: Actionable Intelligence for Social Policy, UPenn

Title: Digital Data Flows Masterclass: Emerging Technologies

State COVID Testing Data Release - Best Practices
New York State Open Data Handbook
Description: This Open Data Handbook is intended as a general guide for government entities participating in data.ny.gov, as well as the general public. The Handbook provides guidelines for identifying, reviewing, and prioritizing publishable state data for publication—with a foundational emphasis on high quality, and metadata and documentation requirements.

Title: Connecticut State Data Plan
Description: The mission of the CT State Data Plan is to connect the people and processes involved with data to promote communication between, and appropriate integration of, formerly siloed data, teams, and systems. The Plan was created to ensure that data are treated as State assets and managed consistently and appropriately across state government. This plan is intended to guide future information technology actions and initiatives, which must be consistent with the Plan going forward.

Title: Data Sharing Playbook (Connecticut)
Description: In this playbook, we lay out strategies that will help Connecticut state agencies share data safely, securely, and ethically. The strategies are based on best practices from other states, specific examples and methods from Connecticut state agencies, and the recommendations found in OPM’s report. The strategies are focused on interagency data sharing, although many practices will also benefit sharing data with the public.
